user.title: 🔗 Add HomieProxy Instance
user.description:
Create a new HTTP proxy instance with custom access controls and restrictions.

**API Access Pattern:**
`/api/homie_proxy/{endpoint_name}?token={token}&url={target_url}`

**Example:** If you name your endpoint 'external-api-route', your proxy will be available at:
`/api/homie_proxy/external-api-route?token=abc123&url=https://example.com`

data_description.name: A unique name for this proxy endpoint (e.g., 'external-api-route', 'development', 'restricted'). This becomes part of your API path: /api/homie_proxy/{endpoint_name}
data_description.restrict_out: Controls which destinations this proxy can access
data_description.restrict_out_custom: Required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above. Use CIDR notation (e.g., 10.0.0.0/8, 203.0.113.0/24)
data_description.restrict_in: Optional: Limit which client IPs can use this proxy (CIDR format, e.g., 192.168.1.0/24)

error.name_exists: ❌ An instance with this name already exists. Please choose a different name.
error.invalid_cidr: ❌ Invalid CIDR notation. Please use format like 192.168.1.0/24 or 10.0.0.0/8
error.custom_cidr_required: ❌ Custom CIDR range is required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above

restrictions.title: 🌐 Configure Access Restrictions
restrictions.description:
Update access controls for endpoint **{current_name}**

**API Path:** `/api/homie_proxy/{current_name}`

**Outbound Restrictions:**
• **Allow all destinations** - No restrictions on target URLs
• **Private networks only** - {private_networks}
• **Local network only** - {local_network}
• **Custom CIDR range** - Specify your own network range

data_description.restrict_out: Controls which destinations this proxy can access
data_description.restrict_out_custom: Required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above. Use CIDR notation (e.g., 10.0.0.0/8, 203.0.113.0/24)
data_description.restrict_in: Optional: Limit which client IPs can use this proxy (CIDR format, e.g., 192.168.1.0/24)

add_token.title: 🔑 Add New Access Token
add_token.description:
A new access token will be generated:

**New Token:** `{new_token}`

**New Endpoint:** `{new_endpoint}`

Confirm to add this token to your instance.

remove_token.title: 🗑️ Remove Access Token
remove_token.description:
**Warning:** Removing a token will immediately disable access for any applications using it.

Currently managing {token_count} token(s). Select the token to remove:

error.invalid_cidr: ❌ Invalid CIDR notation. Please use format like 192.168.1.0/24 or 10.0.0.0/8
error.custom_cidr_required: ❌ Custom CIDR range is required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above

abort.no_tokens: No tokens available to remove. Add a token first.
